docs.snippet: The United States, re-established as the world's largest producer and consumer of beer following relegalization in 1933, produced 58,748,087 barrels, or 68,932,000 hectolitres, in 1937, according to a report made public yesterday by the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States, re-established as the world's largest producer and consumer of beer following relegalization in 1933, produced 58,748,087 barrels, or 68,932,000 hectolitres, in 1937, according to a report made public yesterday by the United Brewers Industrial Foundation.
docs.abstract: Rept on U S beer output, 1937

headline.main: UNITED STATES LEADS IN BEER PRODUCTION; Manufacture Here in 1937 Rose to 58,748,087 Barrels

docs.snippet: All attendance records for symphony concerts in Uruguay were broken last night for Jose Iturbi's farewell appearance. The Urquiza Opera House was packed to capacity and 500 would-be ticket purchasers were turned away.
docs.lead_paragraph: All attendance records for symphony concerts in Uruguay were broken last night for Jose Iturbi's farewell appearance. The Urquiza Opera House was packed to capacity and 500 would-be ticket purchasers were turned away.

headline.main: URUGUAY' CHEERS ITURBI; Large Crowd Greets Conductor on Final Appearance There

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
